tweet: It was a pleasure to be at @ManitowocCo this week to discuss the impact that the #USMCA would have on their operation. During the visit we assisted Manitowoc with their fundraiser for local food pantries. pic.twitter.com/ilitCsVC32

It was a pleasure to visit @kongsbergasa in Johnstown yesterday. During the visit we received an update on the future of their company in Johnstown and the current work they are doing to keep America safe. You can read more about the visit here: https://www.tribdem.com/news/kongsberg-execs-tell-rep-joyce-they-re-very-optimistic/article_410033f0-cada-11e9-9270-8b0e98042bcb.html …
As a veteran and patriot, he showed loyalty and commitment to our community. My wife and I extend sympathies to his wife Jeannie on this loss.
It is with great sadness that I learned of the sudden death of long-time legislator, public servant, and friend Rick Geist. His insights and leadership will be missed.

It was a pleasure to meet with the @NCDMMnews this morning. NCDMM gave us an update on how the services they provide help make the Letterkenny Army Depot stronger, the U.S. defense industry more efficient, and our country safer through the sharing of information and technology. pic.twitter.com/7yzzQewum0

This morning, members from @CASDNews stopped by my Chambersburg office. Thank you to Superintendent Dr. Betts, School Board President Sharpe, and ROTC Commander Apgar for giving us an update on the great things happening at CASD this school year. pic.twitter.com/8IzZHlbGoV

During the visit, we stopped at the Jefferson Building of the @librarycongress where I had the opportunity to view one of the three copies of the Gutenberg Bible that is on display. There you can also see many volumes that were personally owned by Thomas Jefferson. pic.twitter.com/lX2TTAbzdS
Today we had the opportunity to stop by the Library of Congress on the way back from meetings in Washington to collect books to take back to the district for the surplus library book program.

This week I had the opportunity to meet with Leonardo DRS leadership team in Johnstown. This trusted provider of naval power propulsion, ship communications, and computing infrastructure is in the heart of Pennsylvania 13. pic.twitter.com/H4G930RHki

An incredible event at the grand opening of Laurel Ford Lincoln in Windber. The Smith family has made a commitment to the Johnstown and Windber area. The success of Laurel Auto Group is reliant on strong leadership, commitment to service, and an incredible work force. pic.twitter.com/zRJXZNNlFo

Recently I met with Dr. Carolyn Hendricks to discuss issues impacting patient and cancer care in Pennsylvania 13. Dr. Hendricks is an advocate from the American Society of Clinical Oncology. pic.twitter.com/wFAnMX8BE6

This morning I had the opportunity to meet with the Sunrise Rotary in Altoona. This active community service organization meets on a weekly basis and reaches out to Blair County in both service and leadership. It was an honor to be invited to present a Washington update. pic.twitter.com/YR5hrnko8y

Late this afternoon we met with Fulton County Library Librarian Jamie Brambley to present books from the @librarycongress. This impressive library just completed a summer reading program with hundreds of students. pic.twitter.com/6dqXsBs2is

Thank you to @UtzSnacks for welcoming me for a tour this afternoon. What started out as a small family business in 1921 now produces over 3.3 million pounds of snacks each week. The highlight of the tour was getting to taste test some of their snacks. pic.twitter.com/BD7YcqOyb0

It was a pleasure to join the Chambersburg Area Development Corporation for their annual luncheon. The luncheon gave me an opportunity to address the group about what I am doing in Washington to help our small business community, as well as helping advance our workforce. pic.twitter.com/0LP461c0k3

Chambersburg hosted our final school safety discussion this morning. Over these last two days, @CISAHarrell has delivered a wealth of knowledge to first responders and community leaders across PA-13. Preparedness is key, we must all work as a team to keep our students safe. pic.twitter.com/ouHXZlGDHv

Just wrapped up our school saftey discussion in Bedford County with @CISAHarrell. With the new school year right around the corner, these conversations allow us to create a plan to keep our schools secure. pic.twitter.com/GJS6V6YdhY

In between events this morning, @CISAHarrell and I stopped by the @Flight93NPS. Every time I visit this memorial I am overcome with emotion thinking of the heroes on that flight that made the ultimate sacrifice to save countless others. pic.twitter.com/NRBYwT9c4T

This morning was the first of three school safety discussions I am hosting in PA-13 this week with Department of Homeland Security @CISAHarrell. This critical issue requires cooperation between the government, first responders, and community leaders to keep our students safe. pic.twitter.com/aJ7moWXJ69

Following Vesper’s service at the Williamsburg Farm Show, I had the opportunity to connect with Barry England regarding his commitment to the agriculture community in PA-13. Thanks to folks like Barry and their tireless advocacy, our communities are stronger. pic.twitter.com/UpdXIthCJ6
In the barns at the Westmoreland County Fair discussing with local farmers the importance of the United States, Mexico, Canada trade agreement. pic.twitter.com/7AxN8bqYHd

Started the afternoon today at the Somerset County Fair. We arrived just in time to see the judging of the livestock. Events like these serve as a reminder that the agricultural roots of Pennsylvania 13 are alive and well. pic.twitter.com/bKQWpwtCYl

Alice and I joined over 100 walkers and community leaders at the Blair County Drug and Alcohol Partnership Recovery Walk today acknowledging the success that can be achieved when facing addiction. pic.twitter.com/RMRrV3gCMi

Meeting today at the Hollidaysburg Public Library. The library display 
includes a Civil War American flag and I was honored to be asked to sign the guestbook of those who viewed it. They were presented several books from the @librarycongress which will be available for patrons. pic.twitter.com/pD64fLSvGQ

Just finished meeting with Blair County commissioners Bruce Erb, Terry Tomassetti, and Ted Beam at the Blair County Courthouse in Hollidaysburg. We discussed the drug crisis that affects all counties in Pennsylvania 13 at many different levels. pic.twitter.com/A7hzK5Iw8h

This afternoon I met with Blair County Veterans Affairs Director Patrick Young who affirmed his commitment to advocating for veterans throughout Blair County. We talked about how our offices can work together to help resolve issues that our veterans face. pic.twitter.com/rRRcVdPuzP

Today at the Blair County Farm Bureau we addressed the importance of returning whole milk to cafeterias in schools. Another part of our discussion was the importance of passing the #USMCA and the impact it will have on farmers. pic.twitter.com/pipMExTSDv

This morning I had the honor of addressing the Blair County Drug and Alcohol Partnership. These issues have been a focus of my time in Washington where I have done work in a bipartisan manner. pic.twitter.com/EPGeGYVQBi

It was an honor to attend the Change of Command at Letterkenny Army Depot this morning in Franklin County.  We owe Colonel Ledbetter a debt of gratitude for his service and would like to welcome Colonel Gibbons as he joins a long list of respected commanders at LEAD. pic.twitter.com/tacOp4R8bf

When I think of #IMakeAmerica, I think of businesses like @VolvoCE_NA. It was a pleasure to start my morning with them and have the opportunity to address over 300 employees about how the #USMCA will help expand their operation. pic.twitter.com/iRDWnX4QbN

Just wrapped up a visit to the Cambria County Association for the Blind and Handicapped in Johnstown. Under the leadership of Dick Bosserman they employ hundreds of individuals in the mining, energy, and safety industries. pic.twitter.com/kKgSuVQlNn

This afternoon I had the pleasure of meeting with Pennsylvania Highlands Community College President Dr. Walter Asonovich and administration members. @PennHighlands provides educational opportunities for many students throughout their four campus locations in PA-13. pic.twitter.com/bpafLsw8lY

It was great to visit @UPMC Somerset and meet with CEO Andy Rush. During the visit I got the opportunity to speak with hospital employees and received an update on healthcare in Somerset County. pic.twitter.com/hqQcFh5B73

During my visit to the library, I also had the opportunity to meet with STEM Initiative Coordinator Chris Welder. Somerset County Library is taking a hands on approach in the development of science, technology, engineering, and math in our students. pic.twitter.com/HUJGfarbsB

Thank you Cheryl Morgan, Director of the Somerset County Library, for welcoming me this morning to present books from the @librarycongress. Library patrons were already enthusiastic to see the latest additions to the library. pic.twitter.com/PZCEMbnKu8

This morning I visited Guy Chemical Company in Somerset County. Visiting with the employees gave me the opportunity to see firsthand the benefits of the tax cuts and make my commitment to make them permanent even stronger. pic.twitter.com/nuNZccqGa3

Great morning at the Bedford County Government Affairs breakfast. During the breakfast I gave an update on what I’ve been doing to help the constituents of PA-13 during my first eight months in Congress, as well as things I hope we are able to accomplish once we return. pic.twitter.com/caka0Q52P5

Great time at the Altoona Public Library this afternoon where I donated books from the @librarycongress and got to sit with some students. Pennsylvania Career Link Executive Director Gwen Fisher gave me a sneak peak of the new Altoona Careerlink Center while I was there. pic.twitter.com/iXiqMlZoHn

Today I visited @MartinsFoodMkts and @HomeDepot in Altoona. Businesses like these keep our economy moving and I was thrilled to spend time with them this morning learning more about their operations. pic.twitter.com/ZOhc5yeFoX

It was an honor to welcome @SecretarySonny to Pennsylvania this morning for a discussion with dairy farmers from across central Pennsylvania about how the #USMCA will help increase their exports. pic.twitter.com/BRzQLOlaaO

A perfect Friday afternoon with Westmorland County officials and constituents at the 109th annual Westmoreland County Association of Township Supervisors picnic. Special thank you to Supervisor Tom Stull for your hospitality. pic.twitter.com/aeYYMNnu1d

My day began with an incredible morning at Moyers Rolling Green Acres Farm in Manns Choose, Bedford County. Owners Glenn and Matt Moyer discussed the challenges facing dairy farmers and they reinforced the need for Congress to pass the #USMCA. pic.twitter.com/sprbHRVbnV
I spent my Thursday night at the Greencastle-Antrim Old Home Week Association parade. Thank you to Greencastle Mayor Ben Thomas for joining me. pic.twitter.com/ycKO5kusSP
It was a pleasure to be at the Cumberland County Ag Expo this afternoon. PA-13 is filled with family farms and I am proud to fight for them everyday in Congress. pic.twitter.com/LscUot252n

This morning I visited the UPS facility in Altoona where I had the opportunity to talk to the workers as they were getting ready to head out for a hard day’s work. These workers are critical and keep our economy and nation moving. pic.twitter.com/oi0Z7P3jqI

My night ended yesterday at the Tyrone National Night Out Against Crime. It was a pleasure to spend time talking to constituents and thanking our members of law enforcement with @RepJimGregory. pic.twitter.com/5O6IU4r5KM

Last night I visited the Huntingdon County Fair. It was a pleasure to meet with constituents and talk with our dairy farmers about how the #USMCA will he a home run for farmers across PA-13. pic.twitter.com/PBINViAp5C

Yesterday afternoon I had the opportunity to tour the Huntingdon County VA clinic. After the tour, I talked to the staff about issues that our veterans are facing regarding healthcare. pic.twitter.com/m2KkcyyyPS

My father, Sergeant Bernard Joyce, is just one of the 1.8 million service men and women who have received a Purple Heart their service. Today I extended my sincerest gratitude to those who have served and our currently serving for our nation. #PurpleHeartDay pic.twitter.com/eT32nX0hCK

This morning I met with the Army Corps of Engineers regarding the
Johnstown flood protection project. It is of the utmost importance we continue our collaborative efforts to fix the almost 100 year old concrete line channels. pic.twitter.com/2NIEYPR5Hw

Last night I attended Duncansville’s National Night Out Against Crime. It is important that we support our law enforcement officials who put their lives on the line everyday to keep our communities safe. pic.twitter.com/xdSCruHv42

Yesterday, I had the honor of meeting with Harry Beal. Harry is a Somerset County native and America’s first Navy SEAL. Harry served as a member of SEAL Team Two. It was a pleasure to meet such a great patriot and present him with a congressional proclamation for his service. pic.twitter.com/mUHq8qf08J

One of my top priorities this Congress has been helping our veterans. Thanks to folks like Somerset County VA Reprensentative Dan Kinsella, Cambria County VA Reprensentative Zachary Portser, and VA Services Officer Denise Lloyd our veterans get the help they need. pic.twitter.com/Fa2dKd1byC

Today I met with Commissioners in both @CambriaCounty and Somerset County. It is always a pleasure to meet with our local elected leaders to discuss how we can work together to improve our communities. pic.twitter.com/EbEFhGkEVh

This morning, I congratulated BCL Manufacturing on 25 years of business. Small businesses like BCL are the backbone of our economy. I am proud to fight for them as member of @HSBCgop. pic.twitter.com/boexeUQCOs

My Abbottstown office is officially open. My first meeting at the office was with Veterans Advocate Andy Raymond and Adams County Veterans Administrator Stan Clark about how we can help our veterans transition back to civilian life. pic.twitter.com/WjzGAsoNLb

This morning I was joined by @EckerRep to present Vietnam Veterans and Adams County natives Paul Sanko and Cyril Alwine with the Congressional Vietnam Service award. Please join me in thanking these veterans for their service to our nation. pic.twitter.com/yYBURxgCvh

It was a pleasure to be with @PAAgriculture Secretary Russell Redding and @SenMastriano in Adams County to discuss how was can help our local farmers. Labor issues and red tape are hurting our farmers, Congress needs to act to help ease these burdens. pic.twitter.com/cyPDzXXbNm

"There’s one last piece to the puzzle when setting up our economy to prosper for generations to come. And that’s trade.” -> https://www.therecordherald.com/news/20190801/vice-president-mike-pence-visits-manitowoc …

Special thanks to Fulton County Commissioner Stuart Ulsh for showing me around the Fulton County Fair last night. Alice and I enjoyed chatting with members of the agriculture community about what Congress can do to help them. pic.twitter.com/aynTJ9fSo3

The USMCA will be a home run for America and for the 13th District. We should have passed this measure already, and it needs to be the top priority when Congress reconvenes. I agree with @VP - the clock is ticking. More coverage of yesterday's great event at Manitowoc is below. pic.twitter.com/Dq2ILJRN5B

Visiting the South Mountain Fair in Biglerville last night we once again saw the importance of passing the USMCA. Hearing the stories of the farmers throughout the stalls makes us realize that USMCA can level the playing field and allow a re-invigoration of the dairy industry. pic.twitter.com/3uy23c8NJ6

Thank you @VP for coming to Pennsylvania today and for your kind words about how we are working together to pass the USMCA so we can create jobs for our manufacturers and open up new markets for our dairy farmers in #PA13. pic.twitter.com/PC8bMrRldw

Not only will the USMCA create 176,000 jobs and generate an additional $68.2 billion for the country, it also provides major wins for our 13th District in particular. This morning I joined @VP to talk about the need to pass it. #IMakeAmerica @aemadvisor https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LfYxq9bqKCU&feature=youtu.be …

Thrilled be with @VP at @ManitowocCo in Shady Grove, PA today to talk about the need for Congress to pass the #USMCA. You can watch my remarks here:  https://www.imakeamerica.com/usmca/  #IMakeAmerica @aemadvisor
